alert.note: Alert for Lea (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued September 11 at 7:42PM MDT until September 11 at 8:15PM MDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM CDT/815 PM MDT/ FOR SOUTHEASTERN EDDY...SOUTHERN LEA...NORTHWESTERN REEVES...NORTHWESTERN WINKLER...NORTHEASTERN CULBERSON AND NORTHERN LOVING COUNTIES... At 841 PM CDT/741 PM MDT/ strong thunderstorms with damaging wind were located along a line extending from near Eunice to 17 miles east of Malaga to 11 miles southeast of Whites City, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...72 mph winds were measured by the ASOS in Carlsbad. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Eunice, Jal, Jal Airport, Eunice Airport, Red Bluff Reservoir, Orla, Bennett, Oil Center, and Red Bluff. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
